text: Two men were walking in the valley, and one, pointing to the mountain, said, "Do you see that hermitage?" There lives a man who long ago divorced the world. Look for God and nothing else on earth. "He will not find God", said the other man, "until he leaves his hermitage and the solitude that surrounds him, and returns to our world to share our joy and sorrow, to dance with our dancers at our wedding parties, and to weep with those who weep around the coffin of our dead. And the other man persuaded himself in his heart, but, nevertheless, he answered, I agree with what you say, but I think the hermit is a good man. And could not a single good man in his absence work greater goods than the apparent goodness of so many men? FIN
title: Con Dios
author: Gibrán Jalil Gibrán
